_metadata.description: Real-world issue categories from WebView2Feedback GitHub + internal channels. Each entry defines the symptom, expected ETW events, diagnostic checks, and related GitHub issues.

navigation_completed_not_invoked.symptom: NavigationCompleted event not received by host app after calling Navigate
keyChecks: Was NavigationRequest::DidCommitNavigation reached? If not, navigation failed at browser level.
Is WebView2_DifferentNavigationId present? Indicates nav ID mismatch suppression.
Was add_NavigationCompleted (API=37) registered before navigation started?
Is this an about:blank initial navigation? Check for suppression via initializing_navigation_id_.

blank_page_after_navigate.symptom: Page appears blank/white after navigation completes successfully
keyChecks: Was PutIsVisible(false) (API=6) called? Hidden WebViews don't render.
Are bounds zero-size? Check PutBounds (API=28) calls.
Did GPU process crash? Check WebView2_ProcessExited with GPU type.
Is renderer alive? Check for WebView2_RendererUnresponsive.
Is WebView2_SetWindowPos showing non-zero dimensions?

process_failed_browser_crash.symptom: ProcessFailed event fires or browser process crashes unexpectedly
keyChecks: What is the exit_code in WebView2_BrowserProcessFailure?
Is WebView2_ProcessFailureTypeWithReason present? What reason?
Was this during initialization or mid-session?
Are multiple WebView2 browser processes restarting (restart loop)?

initialization_failure_timeout.symptom: WebView2 creation fails, times out, or takes very long
keyChecks: Is WebView2_Creation_Client async pair complete? Check duration.
Is WebView2_WebViewProcessLaunchType=0 (cold start)? Cold starts are slower.
Is WebView2_FactoryConnectionError present? IPC to browser failed.
Is this a headless/service context? Check WebView2_WindowImpl_Init_Failed.
Is runtime version valid? Check WebView2_Invalid_Version / WebView2_version_too_old.

input_frozen_mouse_unresponsive.symptom: Mouse/keyboard input stops working, WebView appears frozen
keyChecks: Is WebView2_RendererUnresponsive present? Renderer main thread is blocked.
Is WM_PAINT flooding? Check for WS_EX_COMPOSITED window style.
Is renderer main thread busy with JS? Check CPU trace for long-running scripts.
Are focus events (API=43/45 GotFocus/LostFocus) still firing?

print_api_failure.symptom: PrintAsync, PrintToPdf, or ShowPrintUI fails or returns error
keyChecks: Was navigation fully complete before printing? Print requires loaded content.
Is this a windowless/visual hosting controller? Some print paths require windowed.
Check runtime version — v144.0.3719.x has known PrintAsync OtherError regression.
Was WebView2_InvokeFinished received for the print call? If not, print hung.
Was Close/Dispose called during print? Check WebView2_CloseInternal timing.

dispose_teardown_crash.symptom: Exception or crash when calling Close/Dispose on WebView2
keyChecks: Was Dispose called while async operation in progress (print, navigate, script)?
Was print dialog open when Dispose was called?
Is WebView2_WaitForDescendantsTimeOut present? Processes not cleaning up.
Check for COMException 0x8007139F (RPC server unavailable).
Was WebView2_WatcherTerminateProcess needed (forced kill)?

download_event_not_firing.symptom: DownloadStarting event doesn't fire when user downloads a file
keyChecks: Was AddDownloadStarting (API=128) called before the download was triggered?
Is WebView2_NoEventDispatcher or WebView2_DroppedEvent present?
Is the download triggered by navigation (content-disposition) or anchor click?

memory_leak_high_usage.symptom: Memory usage grows unbounded, multiple renderer processes
keyChecks: Is renderer count growing? Compare WebView2_Creation_Client count vs WebView2_ProcessExited count.
Are navigations creating new renderers without closing old? (cross-origin navigations)
Is PutMemoryUsageTargetLevel (API=137) being used?
Are TrySuspend (API=105) calls being made for inactive WebViews?

headless_creation_fails.symptom: WebView2 creation fails in headless, windowless, or Windows service context
keyChecks: Is interactive desktop session available? Windows services run in session 0.
Check WebView2_WindowImpl_Init_Failed for window creation errors.
Was the HWND parameter valid or NULL?
Consider using CreateCoreWebView2CompositionController for windowless hosting.
Is window.chrome.webview accessed before CoreWebView2 fully initialized?
Is the page navigated to the correct origin (file://, https://)?
Was AddWebMessageReceived (API=57) registered?
Was AddScriptToExecuteOnDocumentCreated (API=11) used to inject scripts?

runtime_version_regression.symptom: Feature that previously worked breaks after WebView2 runtime update
keyChecks: Compare runtime version from WebView2_SDKVersion against known regression versions.
Is the issue reproducible with a pinned/fixed runtime version?
Check if the host app pins a specific runtime version or uses Evergreen.

knownRegressionVersions.issue: NavigationCompleted not invoked in failure cases

proxy_network_auth_blocks.symptom: Corporate proxy or network blocks WebView2 authentication flow
keyChecks: Is NavigationRequest::OnRequestFailedInternal present for auth URLs?
Is WebTokenRequestResultOperation_ActivityError present?
Check for PAC script issues with msWebView2BlockAllPACScripts flag.
Is BasicAuthenticationRequested handler (API=155) registered?

execute_script_timeout.symptom: ExecuteScript call never returns or times out
keyChecks: Was ExecuteScript (API=5) called before navigation completed?
Is the renderer process alive? Check WebView2_RendererUnresponsive.
Is WebView2_CallCDPMethodFailed present? CDP communication failed.
Check CPU trace for renderer main thread — is it blocked?

dpi_scaling_rendering.symptom: Content renders at wrong scale, size, or position after DPI change or on multi-monitor
keyChecks: Multi-monitor with different DPIs? Check WebView2_GetDpiAwareness.
Is WebView2_IncompatibleDPI present? App and WebView2 have different DPI awareness.
Check PutBounds (API=28) / SetBoundsAndZoomFactor (API=87) calls around DPI change.
Is NotifyParentWindowPositionChanged (API=74) being called after window moves?

nav_blocked_by_pending_commit.symptom: Navigation deferred because about:blank commit is still pending (kBlockedByPendingCommit)
keyChecks: Is about:blank commit still pending when real navigation starts?
Look for kBlockedByPendingCommit in ETL — navigation queued behind about:blank
Check gap between LoadURLWithParams and actual commit — >1s indicates blocking
Is service worker activation delaying the about:blank commit?
Check if 'Resume task posted' appears with multi-second delay after network response

sw_activation_blocking_navigation.symptom: Service worker synchronous cache deletion blocks navigation for 8-10 seconds
keyChecks: Is SW activation handler doing synchronous cache iteration + deletion?
Check ForwardServiceWorkerToWorkerReady duration — >2s is problematic
Test with offline bundle to bypass service worker and confirm root cause
Look for sequential await caches.keys() + await caches.delete() — should use Promise.all
Is SW registration end vs activation timing mismatched?

integrity_level_perf_regression.symptom: WebView2 creation and visibility perf regressed when switching from LowIL to MediumIL (full trust)
keyChecks: Compare WebView2_Creation_Client duration between LowIL and MediumIL builds
Check CPU trace for increased regkey queries/permission checks during creation
Is HandleVisibilityChanged showing higher cost in full trust?
Compare PutIsVisible timing between integrity levels

shutdown_blocking_new_launch.symptom: WebView2 fails to launch because a previous WebView2 shutdown is still in progress
keyChecks: Is a previous WebView2_CloseInternal still pending when new FactoryCreate arrives?
Check WaitForDescendantsTimeOut — processes not cleaning up fast enough
Was WatcherTerminateProcess needed (forced kill)?
Is this a SearchHost restart scenario where old instance hasn't fully exited?

white_flash_dark_mode.symptom: Search flashes white in dark mode before painting the screen — WS_VISIBLE style missing on Chrome_WidgetWin_0
keyChecks: Is WS_VISIBLE style missing for Chrome_WidgetWin_0 during startup?
Compare cold vs warm launch ETLs — is flash only on cold?
Check putDefaultBackground timing relative to first paint
Is WebView2_SetWindowPos showing the window becoming visible before content is ready?

nav_not_started_memory_pressure.symptom: Navigation fails to start within 10s window due to memory pressure — SearchHost recovery kills and restarts
keyChecks: Does WV2 wait ~5s after memory recovery before attempting navigation?
Is E_NOINTERFACE (0x80004002) observed — indicates COM interface issue under pressure
Is BeyondTrust Defendpoint or other DLP/AV software present and interfering?
Check if older WV2 versions are deployed in this environment
Is the 10s navigation timeout being hit before WV2 becomes ready?

searchhost_init_error_0x8007023E.symptom: SearchControl_WebView_Initialized reports error 0x8007023E — WebView2 created but no Navigate call observed
keyChecks: Was CreateCoreWebView2ControllerAsync called and completed? Check timing.
Was about:blank navigation successful from WebView2 side?
Is there any Navigate call after initialization? Check for zero API=3 events.
Check putDefaultBackground and other setup calls between init and navigate
HRESULT 0x8007023E = ERROR_RESOURCE_LANG_NOT_FOUND — may indicate resource/locale issue

udf_bloat_perf_degradation.symptom: Gradual performance degradation in long-running apps due to User Data Folder bloat
keyChecks: Is HTTP cache, IndexedDB, or SW storage growing unbounded?
Are LocalStorage synchronous operations increasing in latency?
Is memory footprint growing over time without corresponding renderer cleanup?
Compare navigation latency early vs late in app session

blank_but_responsive_js_works.symptom: Search box blank yet responsive — JavaScript running, keyboard nav works, but WV2 not rendering
keyChecks: Is navigation fully committed and DOMContentLoaded fired?
Is PutIsVisible(true) called? Check API=6 calls.
Are bounds non-zero? Check PutBounds (API=28).
Is GPU process alive? Check WebView2_ProcessExited for GPU type.
Is Chrome_WidgetWin_0 WS_VISIBLE set?

transparent_window_memory_regression.symptom: Memory regression (7-16%) after transparent window fix, detected via Performance Lab bisection
keyChecks: Compare WebView2_CreationTime values before/after the regression window.
Check memory:chrome:all_processes:reported_by_chrome:effective_size via Iriscope.
Is edge_webview.system_health_memory elevated vs baseline?
Was transparent window codepath activated? Check for multi-content view feature flags.
transparent_window_memory_regression.notes: Detected by automated bisection — transparent window PR caused 7.23-16.21% memory increase in edge_webview benchmarks.

shared_worker_init_failure_reload.symptom: SharedWorker initializes on first load but fails silently on reload when using the same worker URL
keyChecks: Does the SharedWorker script fetch (e.g., cw.js) show empty response body on reload?
Is the worker URL identical across first load and reload?
Check network events — is the worker script served from SW cache vs network?
Reproducible in WebView2 sample app — not Teams-specific.
shared_worker_init_failure_reload.notes: Worker becomes non-functional after page reload with same URL. Main thread and SW thread both fetch worker script but response may be empty.

minimal_init_missing_objects.symptom: Navigation or UI queries fail because objects were never created during minimal/optimized initialization
keyChecks: Was WebView2_ClientWindowInit fired? If not, window-dependent UI may fail.
Is minimal window optimization enabled? Some code paths expect objects created during full init.
Do navigation or rendering paths query presentation-layer objects that no longer exist?
Check if the failure is path-dependent — some UI flows work while others fail.
minimal_init_missing_objects.notes: Minimal window / minimal initialization optimizations remove creation of components that some code paths still depend on. Not a crash — a missing object race.

tls_tpm_networking_failure.symptom: TLS connections terminate unexpectedly due to TPM-backed RSA-PSS signature incompatibility
keyChecks: Does the TLS handshake complete? Check for FIN after encrypted closure alert.
Is TLS 1.3 in use? TPM-backed RSA-PSS may fail with BoringSSL.
Check net-export logs for NCrypt failure on Windows.
Is the failure environment-specific (e.g., corporate proxy, HSM/TPM-backed certs)?
Browser process TTD trace may be needed for deeper investigation.
tls_tpm_networking_failure.notes: Chromium/BoringSSL may fail when TPMs cannot produce TLS-compatible RSA-PSS signatures. Requires net-export logs and possibly browser process TTD trace.

renderer_app_container_crash.symptom: Renderer crashes on navigation in Low Integrity Level desktop apps after RendererAppContainer enablement
keyChecks: Is WebView2_ProcessExited present with RenderProcessExited or FrameRenderProcessExitedFailure?
Is the host app running at Low Integrity Level (Low-IL)?
Was RendererAppContainer enabled by default in this build?
Check for missing capability SID for renderer processes.
Watson crash signatures may show renderer crash on first navigation.
renderer_app_container_crash.rootCause: RendererAppContainer enabled by default caused missing capability SID for renderer processes in Low-IL apps. Fix: disable RendererAppContainer for non-AppContainer Low-IL scenarios.

select_dropdown_dismissed_wpf.symptom: HTML <select> dropdown immediately dismisses in WPF-hosted WebView2 apps (v134)
keyChecks: Is the host a WPF application?
Is WebView2 runtime v134?
Are frequent WM_MOVE messages being generated? Upstream Chromium change causes select popup dismissal.
Does the issue reproduce in WinForms or Win32? If not, it's WPF-specific WM_MOVE handling.
select_dropdown_dismissed_wpf.rootCause: Upstream Chromium change caused frequent WM_MOVE events in WPF hosts, dismissing select dropdowns. Fix backported to v134 and v135.

custom_url_scheme_broken.symptom: Custom URL schemes used by embedded browser scenarios (e.g., SAP GUI) stop working after WebView2 144
keyChecks: Is the app using custom URL schemes (non-standard protocols)?
Is WebView2 runtime v144 or newer?
Does NavigationRequest::OnRequestFailedInternal appear for custom scheme URLs?
Does downgrading to v143 fix the issue?
custom_url_scheme_broken.rootCause: Platform change in Edge 144 altered handling of custom URL schemes used by embedded browser scenarios. Fix shipped in 144.0.3719.92.

dark_mode_not_honored.symptom: System dark mode theme not applied in WebView2 apps
keyChecks: Is system dark mode enabled?
Is the WebView2 content rendering in light mode despite system dark mode?
Check if IsEdgeThemeServiceDarkModeEnabled flag is present in WebView2 runtime.
This was a missing code path in WebView2 that Edge had — themes routing logic absent.
dark_mode_not_honored.rootCause: Themes code change introduced IsEdgeThemeServiceDarkModeEnabled flag and routing logic present in Edge but missing in WebView2. Fix: added missing theme logic to WebView2.

gpu_process_crash_webgl_oom.symptom: GPU process exits and restarts causing visual artifacts, blank frames, or content flash
keyChecks: Is WebView2_ProcessExited present with GPU process type?
Check edge://gpu for GPU reset or driver failure indicators.
Is the page using WebGL? WebGL operations fail silently before eventually killing GPU process.
Are there detached DOM nodes causing gradual memory growth?
GPU process auto-restarts but content may flash or require re-render.
gpu_process_crash_webgl_oom.rootCause: WebGL OOM, context loss, or GPU driver incompatibility causes GPU process exit. WebGL functions do not throw — errors only visible via WebGL error inspection.

service_worker_force_update_nav_stall.symptom: Navigation stalls because service worker is force-updated on DevTools/CDP detach
keyChecks: Is ForwardServiceWorkerToWorkerReady present with a large time gap before DidCommitNavigation?
Is the app using WebResourceRequested (WRR) interception?
WRR uses CDP internally — Chromium CL 6619069 forces SW reload on DevTools detach.
Is navigation paused while service worker is being re-activated?
Mitigation: WebView2 bypass of force-update logic while upstream fix pending.
service_worker_force_update_nav_stall.rootCause: Upstream Chromium change forces service worker reload on DevTools detach for security. Since WRR uses CDP, this forces SW updates even when SW script is not intercepted, causing navigation stalls.

profile_deletion_hresult_mismatch.symptom: CreateWebView fails with wrong HRESULT (kUnexpectedError instead of kErrorDeletePending) after profile deletion
keyChecks: Was a profile just deleted before calling CreateWebView?
Is WebView2_CreationFailure present with HRESULT indicating unexpected error?
Expected: kErrorDeletePending (14). Actual: kUnexpectedError (10).
Root cause: basename vs full path mismatch in profile deletion detection logic.
profile_deletion_hresult_mismatch.rootCause: Basename vs full path mismatch in profile deletion detection caused incorrect error code. Expected kErrorDeletePending (14) but returned kUnexpectedError (10).

double_title_bar_win10.symptom: Double or persistent title bar appears on Windows 10 in WebView2 v144
keyChecks: Is the host running on Windows 10?
Is WebView2 runtime v144?
Is an extra title bar visible covering or duplicating the app title bar?
UI regression in window rendering behavior specific to Win10.
double_title_bar_win10.rootCause: UI regression in WebView2 144 caused extra title bar to remain visible on Windows 10 due to window rendering behavior changes. Fix shipped with improved Win10 validation.
